Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • jkhet.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Djed, Obelisk, Pharaoh, Pyramid

    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    Master abstract class for board pieces.

      • getDir

        public int getDir(int x,
                  int y)
        getDir(x,y) -- get direction number (0-7) relative to a piece based on a coordinate
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of location
        y - Y coordinate of location
        Returns:
        Direction number (0-7) of this coordinate relative to the piece. Returns -1 if the location is not one spot away.

      • move

        public int move(int dir)
         throws InvalidMoveException
        Move(int dir) -- move a piece

        When moving, you need to consider: 1 - Is the direction valid? 2 - Is there a piece already present? - If so, can the piece handle collisions? (Djed only) 3 - Is the location a restricted space (red or silver)?

        Parameters:
        dir - Direction of movement (0-7)
        Returns:
        Success (0)
        Throws:
        InvalidMoveException - Indicates if the attempted move is illegal

      • rotate

        public void rotate(boolean dir)
        rotate(boolean dir) -- rotate a piece CW or CCW
        Parameters:
        dir - Direction of rotation; CW (true) or CCW (false)

      • boardMove

        public static void boardMove(int x,
                             int y,
                             int move_dir,
                             int player)
                      throws InvalidMoveException
        boardMove(x,y,move_dir,player) -- initiate a move on the board and report back if it is illegal.
        Parameters:
        x - X location of piece to be moved.
        y - Y location of piece to be moved.
        move_dir - Direction the piece is to be moving (0-7)
        player - Player initiating the move
        Throws:
        InvalidMoveException - Indicates if the attempted move is illegal

      • boardRotate

        public static void boardRotate(int x,
                               int y,
                               boolean rot_dir,
                               int player)
                        throws InvalidMoveException
        boardRotate(x,y,rot_dir,player) -- initiate a rotate on the board and report back if it is illegal.
        Parameters:
        x - X location of piece to be moved.
        y - Y location of piece to be moved.
        rot_dir - Rotation direction (CW (true) or CCW (false))
        player - Player initiating the move
        Throws:
        InvalidMoveException - Indicates if the attempted move is illegal

      • checkVictory

        public static int checkVictory()
        checkVictory() -- check if a player has won at the end of every turn.
        Returns:
        The player who won, or 0 if no player has yet won.

      • reflectDirection

        public abstract int reflectDirection(int laser_direction)
        reflectDirection() -- determines output direction of the laser upon a collision.
        Parameters:
        laser_direction - The direction of entry for the laser, facing inward
        Returns:
        -1 if not a mirrored side and dead; -2 if not a mirrored side but alive; else, return exit direction of laser (0-3)

      • peekLaser

        public static void peekLaser(int player)

        Parameters:
        player - The player whose laser is being viewed
